comments:
See bug #176290: the model supports creation of (optional) JavaEE5 deployment descriptors. 

Would be great to have a checkbox in the wizards for new EJB-/AppClient-/EAR-projects "create JavaEE5 deployment descriptors".
(Or maybe a project context menu option "create JavaEE5 deployment descriptors".

It would make live easier because one does not have to copy/paste the deployment descriptor content from some other file, and some servers (e.g. JBoss 4.0.5 and 4.2.0) even require valid deployment descriptors.

Created an attachment (id=64942)
Add wizard pages for the new JavaEE facets

All the wizard pages do are to subclass the existing *FacetInstallPage, and then add a check box that is synchronized with the GENERATE_DD property.
Verified that this is in this week's integration driver.

Sorry to reopen it but ...
I created a J2EE enterprise application with default appclient, ejb and web modules and checked "Generate Deployment descriptor". 
This created:
-application.xml
-web.xml
Missing are:
-ejb-jar.xml
-application-client.xml

(Creating the modules one by one also created the deployment descriptors)

After adding the modules to the ear in the "J2EE modules to add to the EAR" wizard page I found this exception in the log, don't know whether it is related:

Re-resolving this defect.... please re-open if you are still seeing an exception using property sheet - not related

wtp-S-2.0RC2-200705301353.zip still does not create ejb-jar.xml or application-client.xml when creating an EAR project with default modules.

At least the exception has disappeared from log.
